thread.title: Transport workers call for indefinite strike in Sylhet
thread.title_full: Transport workers call for indefinite strike in Sylhet

title: Transport workers call for indefinite strike in Sylhet
text:
Transport workers call for indefinite strike in Sylhet Sylhet Correspondent, bdnews24.com Previous Next Transport workers have called for an indefinite strike in Sylhet. 
The strike comes in protest against police action against transport workers demonstrating for the release of two fellow workers, according to Sylhet Microbus Samity. 
No local or long route bus left the city since Saturday morning. 
The workers were seen blocking roads and burning tyres at Chondipul, Humayun Chattar, and Tuker Bazar. 
Sylhet District Microbus Samity president Shah Ripon Ahmad said they demand release of two workers held on Friday night. Police attacked a peaceful demonstration of transport workers the same night and vandalised a pickup truck, he told bdnews24.com.
Sylhet District Road Transport Union leaders echoed with him. 
Sylhet Metropolitan Police's Additional Commissioner Rokon Uddin however, denied the claim. 
He said, police detained to truck workers - Toron Mia and Shahin Ahmad - in possession of drugs from the city's Mohajanpatti on Friday evening. 
"Hearing the news, truck workers reached the DB office. Police removed them from the neighbourhood but did not attack them or vandalise any vehicle."
